alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:22PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Elbert, southeastern Arapahoe, southwestern Washington and north central Lincoln Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 520 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Cottonwood Valley to 5 miles northwest of Limon to 5 miles south of Simla, or along a line extending from 43 miles south of Fort Morgan to 5 miles northwest of Limon to 38 miles east of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Limon, Cottonwood Valley and Matheson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
